New Records: Cole Anthony scored 14 out of a total of 24 points in the second half
Key Match Events: Jett Howard gave Magic a lead that was no longer overtaken by a three-point shot before buzzer, making the score 53-51.
Mikal Bridges had brought the Knicks closer with a score of 83-78 through a jump shot at 7:53 in the fourth quarter.
Carter added two points after Bridges failed to score.
Pre-Game Insights: The Knicks suffered without Karl-Anthony Towns due to a knee injury.
Paolo Banchero, Magic's young star, is also still missing the 33rd straight game due to a right-handed oblique injury.
Post-Match Reflections: The Knicks suffered their third straight defeat, which is their longest consecutive defeat of the season.

The Knicks recorded their lowest three-point shot percentage this season, only 18.2 percent (4 out of 22), and failed to score three points in 15 consecutive attempts before Cameron Payne slotted a three-point shot at the last second.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cole Anthony scored three-point shot without missing against the Knicks.
Carter, who previously only managed to get 8 of 50 three-point shots this season, scored three-point shot without missing against the Knicks.
Knicks had taken the lead in the first quarter, but both teams exchanged advantages nine times in the second quarter.
Others: Armed with this victory, Magic managed to avoid a clean sweep defeat in four regular seasons against the Knicks.
Total Carter Jr. scored 19 points from the bench, while Kentavideny Badminton-Pope added 15 points and Jonathan Isaac, also from the bench, contributed 13 points to Magic.
